sessions.stage_objective: Build rapport, clarify goals, assess the problem, and agree on a simple tracking task.

ccd.Situation: Walking past the animal shelter and feeling unable to enter due to fear of rejection from the animals.
Automatic_Thoughts: The animals will hate me for leaving.
I'm not good enough to volunteer there anymore.
If they don't remember me, it feels like everything I've done doesn’t matter.
Behaviors: avoiding going back to the shelter
distancing myself from other volunteers
replaying the visit in my mind
observing from a distance
Intermediate_Beliefs: If they don't remember me, then I must not be good enough.
If the animals hate me, then my work doesn’t matter.
If I was better, they wouldn’t act that way.
Core_Beliefs: I must be memorable to be valuable.
I am not cut out for this kind of work.

sessions.stage_objective: Review the log and map situation→thought→emotion→body→behavior to identify automatic thoughts.

ccd.Situation: Walking past the animal shelter after not visiting for a while.
Automatic_Thoughts: The animals will hate me for not going in sooner.
I let the animals down.
I'm not good enough to volunteer there anymore.
They've labeled me as 'the one who left.'
Behaviors: Avoiding going to the shelter.
Walking past the shelter without looking directly.
Trying to observe animals from a distance.
Intermediate_Beliefs: If I was better or more memorable, they wouldn’t have acted that way.
If the animals don’t remember me, it feels like everything I've done doesn’t matter.
Core_Beliefs: I'm not cut out for this kind of work.
I must be perfect to be acceptable.

sessions.stage_objective: Reality-test distorted thoughts and generate a more balanced alternative thought.

ccd.Situation: Going to the animal shelter where I volunteer and feeling rejected by the animals.
Automatic_Thoughts: The animals will hate me for not remembering me.
I'm not good enough to volunteer there anymore.
They don't remember me, so why bother anymore?
Behaviors: Avoiding going to the shelter.
Walking faster past the shelter.
Not observing the animals as much as planned.
Intermediate_Beliefs: If I was better or more memorable, they wouldn’t have acted that way.
If they don't remember me, it feels like everything I've done doesn’t matter.
Core_Beliefs: I must be perfect to be accepted.

sessions.stage_objective: Create adaptive replacement scripts and an If–Then plan for predictable triggers.

ccd.Situation: Feeling anxious about going back to the animal shelter after animals didn't recognize me during a past visit.
Automatic_Thoughts: The animals will hate me for leaving.
I'm not good enough to volunteer there anymore.
They don't remember me, so why bother anymore?
Maybe I'm just not cut out for this kind of work.
What if they hate me for not going in sooner?
I let the animals down.
Behaviors: Avoiding going back to the shelter.
Passing by the shelter without entering.
Trying to observe animals from a distance.
Racing heart and tightness in chest.
Walking faster to avoid being seen.
Intermediate_Beliefs: If the animals don't remember me, then I've failed.
If I don't act memorable, then I will be ignored.
If they don't respond to me, then I am not good at my job.
I should have done something different to be remembered.
Core_Beliefs: I must be liked by the animals to be a good volunteer.

sessions.stage_objective: Practice coping skills and design a concrete plan for high-risk moments.

ccd.Situation: Walking past the animal shelter and not being recognized by the animals.
Automatic_Thoughts: The animals will hate me for not remembering me.
I'm not good enough to volunteer there anymore.
They don't remember me, so why bother anymore?
I'm just not cut out for this kind of work.
Maybe they’ve really forgotten me.
Behaviors: Avoiding going back to the shelter.
Walking faster past the shelter and not looking directly at it.
Leaving early from volunteering at the shelter.
Trying to observe animals from a distance.
Intermediate_Beliefs: If the animals don’t remember me, then I must not be good enough.
If I see them not respond, then I will feel rejected.
I should always be memorable to the animals.
If I avoid the shelter, it won't hurt as much.
Core_Beliefs: I need the approval of others to feel worthy.
I am a failure if I am not recognized.

sessions.stage_objective: Review gains and formalize a long-term maintenance plan and setback prevention.

ccd.Situation: Going back to the animal shelter where I volunteer after not being recognized by the animals.
Automatic_Thoughts: The animals will hate me for not remembering me.
I'm not good enough to volunteer there anymore.
They don't remember me, so why bother anymore?
Maybe they’ve really forgotten me.
Behaviors: Avoiding going back to the shelter
Walking past without going in
Noticing animal behavior from a distance
Leaving early from the shelter
Intermediate_Beliefs: If I was better or more memorable, they wouldn’t have acted that way.
If the animals don’t react positively, it means I’ve failed.
If they don't respond, I must have let them down.
Core_Beliefs: I'm not cut out for this kind of work.
I must be instantly liked and recognized to be valued.
I am a failure if animals don't remember me.
